raw_response: {"answer_index": 3, "answer_text": "Sensorineural hearing loss", "confidence": 10, "reasoning": "Congenital cytomegalovirus (CMV) infection is a leading cause of sensorineural hearing loss in children. While mental retardation (now termed intellectual disability) can occur, the most common and characteristic sequela is sensorineural hearing loss. Renal failure and hepatic fibrosis are not typical long-term sequelae of congenital CMV infection."}
